publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2623# Tavish Scott: Lifeline Air Links to the Islandsâ€”That the Parliament recognises that the lifeline air services to the Scottish islands are necessities, not luxuries; believes that the commercial air fares charged by the airlines are a tax on island life, handicapping individuals, businesses and public bodies alike, and considers that the Scottish Executive should enter into discussions with Her Majesty's Government and the airlines with a view to using a Public Service Obligation subsidy to reduce the airfares to a more reasonable level.

S1M-2623# Tavish Scott: Lifeline Air Links to the Islands-That the Parliament recognises that the lifeline air services to the Scottish islands are necessities, not luxuries; believes that the commercial air fares charged by the airlines are a tax on island life, handicapping individuals, businesses and public bodies alike, and considers that the Scottish Executive should enter into discussions with Her Majesty's Government and the airlines with a view to using a Public Service Obligation subsidy to reduce the airfares to a more reasonable level. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson*
S1M-2623# Lifeline Air Links to the Islands (lodged on 17 January 2002) Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-2623# Lifeline Air Links to the Islands (lodged on 17 January 2002) Robin Harper*, Michael Russell*
